comment: Very rude professor and not friendly with immigrant students. Lots of students dropped the course and even got out of the program because of her attitude toward them. Her exams are extremely difficult and have no clear grading criteria.

Altogether this class wasn't a great experience. She can come off as pretty rude in her feedback. The feedback wasn't necessarily wrong she just comes off as unpleasant. There didn't seem to be consistency in her grading like she was just using a dart board with potential grades and just firing away. Really not a great experience I would avoid her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment:
Friday: extremely abrasive towards students when asked if they could turn in assignments in a way described on the syllabus, did become far more agreeable when she saw that students were making an effort to engage with the films
Saturday: had many hoops to jump through for a 1 credit course given the sheer amount of work for the PowerPoint

Never take this professor. Run away if you can. The courses are heavy, and she does not bother to read the material before the class. She never actually teaches but works on her computer and asks each weak student to present. You will learn nothing from her and waste your time and resources.

Worst teacher I ve ever had in my graduate program at KSU and in my life. She had unrealistic expectations about the capacity of students to follow her syllabi and PROPERLY prepare the assigned readings. Not really student-oriented, too much confident about her teaching approach. I was frustrated to end up without a solid background in the subject.

Avoid this professor at ALL COST. Her POLS4454 is absolutely miserable; many paper, graded very tough. Think you felt good about that paper? Likely a mid-C or low-B at best. Lectures are basic compared to the tests she gives, and she expects you to know every little thing in great detail. Please sign up for a different if you can.

Prof. Hallward is an expert in her field. Expect to work hard for your grade (which is fair),however, I would never take her classes again. Her expectations are VERY unclear, yet she grades harshly on assignments. She changes the schedule a lot with short notice, and she is very condescending. If you don' have time to play w/ your grade DONT TAKE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Hallward knows here discipline well.  Her teaching style is fined and she expects nothing but the best out of her students.  The first teacher that made me want to go beyond the required reading.  As a student already working in the work force she gives the students real life challenges which will help them as well as myself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Hallward is very smart and knows beyond a ton about her field of study. She will actively play devils advocate in class, so have a thick skin. The class is treated as a masters level course(she's mainly a grad prof), and falling behind will be detrimental. It's incredibly difficult, but you'll learn more about the region than you thought possible.

Tough grader and is very pro-Palestine. I expect teachers especially ones with Phd's to be more open-minded and not biased. Seems a little anti-Semitic to me and allows students to openly bash Israel, but will quickly correct you if you say anything against Palestinians.Unfortunately i think she is the only professor that teaches this course.
She is very confusing. Writes contradictory emails and comments on the papers.She came unprepared to class most of the times. I would suggest she chooses another profession

College is not meant to be easy so it's cool that Dr. Hallward make you earn your grade. An oral, 3 papers, presentation and the final. If you attend class you guranteed to breeze through the class especially if the Middle East appeases you. Awesome class minus the group projects.

I had Dr. Hallward for an Honor's class on Islam Politics. For a 1 credit hour class, the workload was heavy, but Dr. Hallward was fair in grading and also pretty flexible. She knows a lot about the middle east and is good about conveying the information. Overall I enjoyed her class.

VERY hard. Tests are misleading, a lot of comprehension and application of material. If you work DO NOT TAKE! Enormous amounts of reading and writing for an intro level course. Very demanding. If you fall behind you'll never catch up. Good luck to all enrolled, you'll need it.

Racist and hard for any open-minded individual to swallow. in class, she openly harassed, and allowed her students to harass, the deputy consulate general of Israel to the US. It is ridiculous that this woman still has a job.

I had to her for Pol. ME and she's really not that hard.  Our tests were oral and almost everyone got an A.  Yes, there is a LOT of reading to do, but if you're interested in politics in the slightest, you won't mind it at all bc all the readings are relevant and interesting.

Yes she is hard, but if you do the readings and really pay attention you'll do well. She never once spoke down to a student in any of the classes I had her for. Some people are just too sensitive and intimidated by her. She specializes in Mid East studies and is incredibly knowledgeable. VERY timely with responses.

Dr. Hallward is a wonderful professor. She is extremely smart and very helpful. This class required a lot of reading and a lot of work. Be prepared to do weekly assignments, mostly about current events and the readings. I learned a lot in her class. If you want an easy A..... its not going to happen with her.

I am almost done with her online class and I love her! She is one of, if not THE, hardest POLS teacher I've taken so far but she is fair and wants you to do well. I highly recommend her but you have to be dedicated to class and work hard!
One of the most intelligent professors at Kennesaw.  An expert on the Middle East.  Take only if you are seriously interested in subject and you will be happy you did.

Extremely hard! I've never done so much homework in my life. It is really hard to understand her requirements. It is always something wrong with your response. There is one paper and a presentation on it. Don't take this professor if you want an easy class. But if you show her how hard you are trying, she will show some mercy.

She is an extremely hard teacher and grader. I took her class half online and she gave a huge amount of work online. my advice to anyone that has her class half online is before you take the online quiz, copy and paste it so you can study it later. it's exactly like the test.

Dr. Hallward is one of the most intelligent and knowledgeable professor.  You will feel VERY accomplished upon completion of her class. BUT...be warned that she gives a work load similar to a masters program, as though hers was the only class you have to worry about.  Quit your job to do her projects.

Dr. Hallward was a great instructor. Yes, she requires a lot of work, and must think her class is the only one you are taking. VERY tough grader, but I really learned a lot. She facilitates good discussion, and allows for a lot of room for personal opinions. If you are committed, and dont mind a lot of work - take her!

Really hard. Tons of reading and writing. She is flexible but you are always with burden if you take this class. If you are working DO NOT take this class. You will not be able to manage. Tests are impossible- yuo just guess and play coz' there is nothing you can do.

This class is not for someone looking to just skate by. It is a lot of work and requires you to read. But the teacher is very helpful, responds to emails quickly and is super friendly. I would take another class that she teaches.

Expect a lot of reading and a lot of writing. Her course is very difficult. The tests are extremely hard and very hard to comprehend. She provides a study guide, however material is not on test. Overall, she is a nice professor but will expect a lot from you.

She requires an outstanding amount of reading for a lower division introduction course. The class involves a lot of writing and reading using heavy amounts of time and energy. She is not very clear on tested material and is not always present in the time around tests. She is well versed and interested but not the strongest educator available.

I took her online class and I will admit it was hard. She was nice enough though to let me retake a test that I completely forgot about, I was just penalized a letter grade. I never got full credit on the discussion board and I never figured out why. Let's just say I never thought the subject was interesting and she didn't change my mind.

It makes me sick to think I have to sit in classes with people who will complain about a teacher being hard. This is college. If you don't like it drop out. Yes, this is not an easy class. If it was easy you wouldn't learn much. I learned so much in her class. I got an A and I'm not an A student.
to say it politely I would avoid any thing she teaches. It makes no sense she piles work on in excess. and is never clear on anything.

That was the quickest add/drop! I agree with most of the critcisms, most notably her condescending attitude. I want to learn, not be beat down like a 5th grader! My time is as valuable as hers. A disturbing trend with instructors, just the Comm department!

Prior to this class I loved political science and world affairs. However, she completely takes the fun out of the class. She wants things done her way, but will not answer questions thoroughly... For example if you ask, "In what format would you like this done?" She responds, "How do you think it should be?" She also seems to be under the impressio

She is challenging. Her test are hard. Make sure you follow directions on projects. I learned a lot. It was a very interactive class. Students get involved a lot. That helped me out. She offers tons of extra credit opportunities. I would say that she has challenged me most after T. Doleys classes. Take her if you want to learn.

She is a hard teacher. She also grades papers, quizzes and exams very harshly. YOu will follow a country from which you will present a powerpoint slide about it and write a country paper. She will give you extra credit if needed. I learned a great deal, however, you must follow the weekly redings and be very organized with your studying in her clas

She is hard. But I have learned so much from her class. She offers a lot of extra credit if you need it. She stops a lot during her lectures and makes sure you understand the material. She responds to emails super fast. Take her if you want to learn!!! I plan to take her again. GREAT PROFESSOR.
STAY AWAY FROM HER!!!! I took her online and even though I work my butt of got a B. She thinks you don't have anything else to do, just her class. She requires a lot!! If you can DON'T TAKE HER!!!

Her instructions are often very unclear. She can be very confrontational if you question anything. She doesn't do a very good job posting grades. I found her discussion board grades rather unfair. It seems that if she doesn't agree what you are saying you will not score well. Try to stay away from her classes. There are better professors!
hard.

Online teaching is hard for her.  Hard to get in touch with & respones are vague.  Requires grades to be seen in her office/requires papers turned into her office.  Schedules aren't flexible (office hrs./due dates on exams/papers).  Doesn't realize class is online!  Exams were rather easy but lengthy.  Grades papers very harshly, esp. punctuation
